head.title: The Goal: More Miles Per Gallon

hedline.hl1: The Goal: More Miles Per Gallon

abstract.p: Charles F Wurster letter holds Bush-Cheney administration, by abandoning development of fuel-efficient cars in favor of fuel-cell driven cars, has postponed reductions in oil consumption for at least decade (Jan 9 article)

block.p: By abandoning development of fuel-efficient cars in favor of fuel cell-driven cars (front page, Jan. 9), the Bush-Cheney administration has postponed reductions in oil consumption for at least a decade.

Fuel-efficient cars could be here now. America's wasteful oil appetite causes a host of problems: degradation of pristine areas, destructive spills, air pollution with reduced visibility and health damage, and acid rain. Most important, global warming is changing the climate of the planet in potentially disastrous ways.

By abandoning development of fuel-efficient cars in favor of fuel cell-driven cars (front page, Jan. 9), the Bush-Cheney administration has postponed reductions in oil consumption for at least a decade.

Fuel-efficient cars could be here now. America's wasteful oil appetite causes a host of problems: degradation of pristine areas, destructive spills, air pollution with reduced visibility and health damage, and acid rain. Most important, global warming is changing the climate of the planet in potentially disastrous ways.
Increased energy efficiency is the quickest and cheapest path to reduced fossil fuel consumption and a cleaner and healthier world.
CHARLES F. WURSTER Setauket, N.Y., Jan. 10, 2002
The writer is professor emeritus of environmental sciences, SUNY Stony Brook.
